div.bibl: Saloniki-Greek Press, May 21, 1936. SALE OF PROPERTY TO MARSHALL FIELD AND COMPANY

body.p: One of the most successful Greek men in this city, one who managed to survive the depression and competition, is Mr. Theodore Katsiroumbas. He owned the building located at the intersection of Irving, Monticello, and Elston Avenues. It included five stores, ten offices, and three apartments. Mr. Katsiroumbas recently sold this property to Marshall Field and Company for a hundred and thirty thousand dollars.
